single page | use frames     summary     class     fields     routine details     file attributes

./

flowsource__define.pro


Flow field $\vec{u}(\vec{r})$ at specified points $\vec{r}$ due to a localized source of flow consisting of an Oseen tensor $\mathsf{G}(\vec{r})$ and a driving force $\vec{f}_0$. $$\vec{u}(\vec{r}) = \mathsf{G}(\vec{r} - \vec{r}_0) \cdot \vec{f}_0 $$

Author information

Author

David G. Grier, New York University

Copyright

Copyright (c) 2015 David G. Grier

Class description for flowsource

Inheritance

  • IDL_OBJECT

Properties

Properties in flowsource

_extra set
_ref_extra get init
force get set init

3-element vector describing the force $\vec{f}_0$ responsible for the flow.

oseentensor

Reference to the oseentensor object describing the source, $\mathsf{G}(\vec{r})$.

Fields in flowsource

force [0.00000, 0.00000, 0.00000]

3-element array describing force creating the flow at the source.

oseentensor obj_new()

Reference to an oseentensor object describing the flow source.

Routine details

top flowsource::Compute

result = flowsource::Compute(r)

Calculate the flow velocity at r due to the specified source.

Return value

3xN array of velocity vectors at each coordinate.

Parameters

r in required type=fltarr(3,N)

Array of N Cartesian coordinates.
